snippet: Remove Jack Nicklaus and Tiger Woods from the equation the 32 times they have won golf’s top events, and those titles might belong to some illustrious runners-up.
abstract: Dave Anderson Sports of The Times column wonders what golf would be like if Jack Nicklaus and Tiger Woods had never played; says if you remove them from the equation the 32 times they have won golf’s top events, those titles might belong to some illustrious runners-up.
lead_paragraph: Remove Jack Nicklaus and Tiger Woods from the equation the 32 times they have won golf’s top events, and those titles might belong to some illustrious runners-up.

headline.seo: Imagining Golf’s Majors Without Jack Nicklaus and Tiger Woods
headline.main: Imagining the Majors With No Nicklaus or Woods
headline.print_headline: Imagining the Majors With No Nicklaus or Woods
